page.title: 06FARMING PAISLEY
page.content: Altogether{Harelaw Farm}takes up 100 acres. Grass is grown and used for making hay and silage. Barley is also grown and with the silage is used to feed the cows. Rain and drought sometimes affect the crops.Last year drought caused a lot of damage. There are not many trees and what they have are deciduous. Animals are fed by hand but most work is done by machinery.They have{85 cows {120 followers and one Shetland pony.} Hay, barley and silage feed is supplemented by a mineral cake the amount of which given depends on the milk yield of the cow.The higher the yield the higher the quota of mineral cake.Animals are rarely bought but reared from their own stock.The heaviest which they sold last year weighed nearly 1 ton and fetched Â£1000.
